data.title: 准备以至少20秒的时间回答以下问题
data.answer: When it comes to a time when Chinese people would put out decorations for celebration, the first thing that springs to my mind is the Chinese New Year. It is the equivalent of Christmas in most western countries. While there are certainly a large variety of decorations that Chinese people put out for the Chinese New Year, two things are essential. The first is the Fu character, which represents good fortune in Chinese. The second is the New Year couplets on which people write good wishes for the coming year. Both of them are red and the Chinese characters on them are written in either black or gold color. This is because red generally symbolizes flourishment in Chinese culture. (119字)
data.referenceText: What kind of decorations do people put out for holidays and celebrations in your country?
data.referenceTranslate: 在你们国家，人们在节日和庆祝活动时会用什么来装饰?
